item.title: Wait before you make any resolutions
item.description: Wait before you make any resolutions. If you don’t, your resolutions make may cost you time, vital energy, money, and hope about your ability to change. The making of resolutions is a time-worn transition marking the beginning of a new year. Usually, we focus on our deficits, and then create a grocery list of needed changes. If we listen to advertisers, it almost literally turns into a shopping list. Who we are wasn’t good enough.

item.title: Deep Dive: phone addictions; private equity and hospitals
item.description: This week’s featured articles From Harvard Business Review. Do you have a phone addiction? - uhh, probably. Now, do something about it. What happens when hospitals aren’t appropriately funded? They often turn to funding from Private Equity firms. What happens then? It’s not good and costs patients and society.
